message:

message:

message:

message:

message:

message:

title: Only add SRT blocks if the text to make them is not empty; this prevents
message:
Only add SRT blocks if the text to make them is not empty; this prevents

title: Fix for SRT files that contain lines containing only a number, which
message:
Fix for SRT files that contain lines containing only a number, which
were previously being interpreted as the identifier at the start of the
block; now check if the previous line was empty before ending the
current block.

title: SRT files can contain coordinate data after the timestamps; this should
message:
SRT files can contain coordinate data after the timestamps; this should
be ignored by stopping at the first space after the second timestamp, if possible.

title: Some SRT subtitle files begin with 0 instead of 1; allow for all
message:
Some SRT subtitle files begin with 0 instead of 1; allow for all
digits when determining the file type.

title: Fix for SRT blocks that included blank lines not working properly.
message:
Fix for SRT blocks that included blank lines not working properly.
Now we look for a line that contains only number characters instead of
a blank line in order to find when one block ends.

message:

title: Add support for empty endframe tags; in this case the block's endframe
message:
Add support for empty endframe tags; in this case the block's endframe
value should be the same as the next block's start frame value. I have
not seen this used in any files, but it is part of the specification.

message:

message:

There is a big issue here that I had not considered: many subtitle files
begin with a line of text saying where it was downloaded from. This is an
issue as that is not something that can be synced with.
This may be partially remedied by allowing going to the previous/next
subtitles.
